what: A Beta-Binomial mixture model for classification
title: Classify mutations from a targeted sequencing sample
text: INCOMMON implements maximum posteriori classifier infer copy number (\(n_A\) major allele, \(n_B\) minor) multiplicity \(m\) mutations read-count data. classifier based Beta-Binomial mixture model, number reads variant (\(NV\)) number events sequencing depth \(DP\) total number trials. mutation genomic site ploidy \(p = n_A+n_B\), multiplicity \(m\leq \max(n_A,n_B)\), sample purity \(\pi\) expected VAF \[ \mathbb{E}[\text{VAF}] = \frac{m\pi}{p\pi + 2\left(1-\pi\right)} \] read counting process represents event probability. Therefore, based mutation data \(NV\) reads variant locus; \(DP\) coverage locus; sample purity \(\pi\); likelihood observing \(NV\) reads variant \[ P(X = NV | \theta_\eta,\rho, DP) = \text{Beta-Binonmial}\left(NV \;\large\mid\;\normalsize \theta_\eta, \rho, DP\right) \] Setting \(\rho = 0\) corresponds using pure Binomial model model sequencer overdispersion.

title: Classify mutations from a targeted sequencing sample
text: following example, classification task run using default setting \(\rho = 0.01\). input must prepared using function init: lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) sample “P-0002081-T01-IM3” MSK-MetTropsim dataset. sample purity \(\pi = 0.6\) contains mutations called genes KRAS, TP53, STK11 SMARCA4. column gene_role extracted COSMIC Cancer Gene Census (default) catalogue attached input data according gene names. sources gene roles can input user option gene_roles function init. INCOMMON classification sample can performed using function classify. use prior knowledge cut-classification entropy. results classification can visualized using internal plotting function. example:     mutations classified amplification. However, visual inspection plots suggest mutation KRAS low entropy \(H(x) \leq 0.2\). effect, mutation high sequencing depth \(DP\geq500\). Given lower depth, number reads variant \(NV\) (vertical line) mutations compatible multiple copy number configurations, thus assigned similar posterior probabilities.
code: input = init(mutations = example_data$data,              sample = example_data$sample,              purity = example_data$purity,              tumor_type = example_data$tumor_type,              gene_roles = cancer_gene_census) print(input) #> ── [ INCOMMON ]  Sample P-0002081-T01-IM3 (LUAD), with purity 0.6 ────────────── #> # A tibble: 4 × 10 #>   chr       from       to ref   alt   gene       NV    DP   VAF gene_role #>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <int> <int> <dbl> <chr>     #> 1 chr12 25398285 25398285 C     A     KRAS      378   743 0.509 oncogene  #> 2 chr17  7577139  7577139 G     A     TP53      116   246 0.472 TSG       #> 3 chr19  1221293  1221293 C     A     STK11     122   260 0.469 TSG       #> 4 chr19 11141472 11141473 -     C     SMARCA4   133   271 0.491 TSG out = classify(   x = input,   priors = NULL,   entropy_cutoff = NULL,   rho = 0.01 ) #>  #> ── INCOMMON inference of copy number and mutation multiplicity for sample P-0002 #> ℹ Performing classification #> ✔ Loading CNAqc, 'Copy Number Alteration quality check'. Support : <https://caravagn.github.io/CNAqc/> print(out) #> ── [ INCOMMON ]  Sample P-0002081-T01-IM3 (LUAD), with purity 0.6 ────────────── #> ── [ INCOMMON ]  Classified mutations using Beta-binomial model with overdispers #> # A tibble: 4 × 15 #>   chr      from     to ref   alt   gene     NV    DP   VAF gene_role id    label #>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <int> <int> <dbl> <chr>     <chr> <chr> #> 1 chr12  2.54e7 2.54e7 C     A     KRAS    378   743 0.509 oncogene  chr1… 3N (… #> 2 chr17  7.58e6 7.58e6 G     A     TP53    116   246 0.472 TSG       chr1… 3N (… #> 3 chr19  1.22e6 1.22e6 C     A     STK11   122   260 0.469 TSG       chr1… 3N (… #> 4 chr19  1.11e7 1.11e7 -     C     SMAR…   133   271 0.491 TSG       chr1… 3N (… #> # ℹ 3 more variables: state <chr>, posterior <dbl>, entropy <dbl> plot_classification(out) #> [[1]] #>  #> [[2]] #>  #> [[3]] #>  #> [[4]]

what: Using priors and the entropy cut-off.
title: Classify mutations from a targeted sequencing sample
text: classification can made easier injecting prior knowledge model. function classify, user can provide table argument prior. INCOMMON provides internal table prior distributions obtained PCAWG whole-genomes: know classify mutations using priors. Since biasing classification prior knowledge, now reasonable also make classification stricter using cut-entropy. default value entropy_cutoff \(0.20\). Mutations classification entropy cutoff flagged Tier-2. Tumour suppressor genes TP53, STK11 SMARCA4 high frequency LOH PCAWG, low frequency amplification. Injecting prior knowledge model pushes classification outcome towards states. effect using prior evident classification plots:
code: pcawg_priors #> # A tibble: 4,466 × 4 #>    gene  tumor_type label                 p #>    <chr> <chr>      <chr>             <dbl> #>  1 ALB   HCC        1N (Mutated: 1N) 0.151  #>  2 ALB   HCC        2N (Mutated: 1N) 0.593  #>  3 ALB   HCC        2N (Mutated: 2N) 0.0474 #>  4 ALB   HCC        3N (Mutated: 1N) 0.0727 #>  5 ALB   HCC        3N (Mutated: 2N) 0.0485 #>  6 ALB   HCC        4N (Mutated: 1N) 0.0198 #>  7 ALB   HCC        4N (Mutated: 2N) 0.0683 #>  8 APOB  HCC        1N (Mutated: 1N) 0.151  #>  9 APOB  HCC        2N (Mutated: 1N) 0.593  #> 10 APOB  HCC        2N (Mutated: 2N) 0.0474 #> # ℹ 4,456 more rows out = classify(   x = input,   priors = pcawg_priors,   entropy_cutoff = 0.2,   rho = 0.01 ) #>  #> ── INCOMMON inference of copy number and mutation multiplicity for sample P-0002 #> ℹ Performing classification #> → No LUAD-specific prior probability specified for KRAS #> → Using a pan-cancer prior #> → No LUAD-specific prior probability specified for TP53 #> → Using a pan-cancer prior #> → No LUAD-specific prior probability specified for STK11 #> → Using a pan-cancer prior #> → No LUAD-specific prior probability specified for SMARCA4 #> → Using a pan-cancer prior print(out) #> ── [ INCOMMON ]  Sample P-0002081-T01-IM3 (LUAD), with purity 0.6 ────────────── #> ── [ INCOMMON ]  Classified mutations using Beta-binomial model with overdispers #> # A tibble: 4 × 15 #>   chr      from     to ref   alt   gene     NV    DP   VAF gene_role id    label #>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <int> <int> <dbl> <chr>     <chr> <chr> #> 1 chr12  2.54e7 2.54e7 C     A     KRAS    378   743 0.509 oncogene  chr1… 3N (… #> 2 chr17  7.58e6 7.58e6 G     A     TP53    116   246 0.472 TSG       chr1… 1N (… #> 3 chr19  1.22e6 1.22e6 C     A     STK11   122   260 0.469 TSG       chr1… 1N (… #> 4 chr19  1.11e7 1.11e7 -     C     SMAR…   133   271 0.491 TSG       chr1… 1N (… #> # ℹ 3 more variables: state <chr>, posterior <dbl>, entropy <dbl> plot_classification(out) #> [[1]] #>  #> [[2]] #>  #> [[3]] #>  #> [[4]]

what: Copy number and mutation multiplicity assessment
title: INCOMMON
text: INCOMMON assess, every mutation, following statuses: 1 (loss heterozygosity LOH), 2 (heterozygous homozygous), 3 (trisomy), 4 (tetrasomy); Multiplicity 1 2; INCOMMON implements classifier based maximum posteriori estimation; required inputs : read counts mutation purity tumour sample \(\pi > 0\) Tumour sample purity \(\pi\) can estimated copy number assessment, pathology assessment, general bioinformatics approach outside INCOMMON. INCOMMON assumes input purity correct.

title: INCOMMON
text: Input must prepared using function init. input function must contain: mutations: tibble dataframe containing mutations sample. Columns indicate coordinates (chromosome chr, start position , end position ), type substitution (reference ref alternative alt alleles), sequencing coverage DP, number reads variant NV, variant allelic frequency VAF gene name gene (preferably Hugo Symbol) sample: name ID sample purity, tumor sample purity example input dataset.
code: x = init(   mutations = example_data$data,   sample = example_data$sample,   purity = example_data$purity,   tumor_type = example_data$tumor_type ) print(x) #> ── [ INCOMMON ]  Sample P-0002081-T01-IM3 (LUAD), with purity 0.6 ────────────── #> # A tibble: 4 × 10 #>   chr       from       to ref   alt   gene       NV    DP   VAF gene_role #>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <int> <int> <dbl> <chr>     #> 1 chr12 25398285 25398285 C     A     KRAS      378   743 0.509 oncogene  #> 2 chr17  7577139  7577139 G     A     TP53      116   246 0.472 TSG       #> 3 chr19  1221293  1221293 C     A     STK11     122   260 0.469 TSG       #> 4 chr19 11141472 11141473 -     C     SMARCA4   133   271 0.491 TSG

what: Inference of copy number and mutation multiplicity in oncology
title: Inference of copy number and mutation multiplicity in oncology
text: INCOMMON tool INference COpy number Mutation Multiplicity ONcology. INCOMMON infers copy number multiplicity somatic mutations tumour-read count data, can applied classify mutations large-size datasets efficient fast way. Mutations classified either Tier-1 (present 100% cells) without copy-number alterations (heterozygous mutant diploid HMD), loss heterozygosity (LOH), copy-neutral LOH (CNLOH), amplification (), Tier-2 (subclonal high ploidy low multiplicity).

title: Inference of copy number and mutation multiplicity in oncology
text: can install development version INCOMMON GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("caravagnalab/INCOMMON")

title: Inference of copy number and mutation multiplicity in oncology
text: Cancer Data Science (CDS) Laboratory.

what: Gene roles from COSMIC Cancer Gene Census — cancer_gene_census
title: Gene roles from COSMIC Cancer Gene Census — cancer_gene_census
text: table contains gene roles cancer, obtained COSMIC Cancer Gene Census v98. Data curated gene list assigned either TSG oncogene.

title: Gene roles from COSMIC Cancer Gene Census — cancer_gene_census
code: data(cancer_gene_census)

title: Gene roles from COSMIC Cancer Gene Census — cancer_gene_census
text: data frame 733 rows 2 columns: gene Name gene (Hugo Symbol) gene_role Tumour Suppressor Gene (TSG) oncogene

text: COSMIC Cancer Gene Census: https://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/census

code: x = init(mutations = example_data$data,          sample = example_data$sample,          purity = example_data$purity,          tumor_type = example_data$tumor_type) x = classify(     x = x,      priors = pcawg_priors,     entropy_cutoff = 0.2,     rho = 0.01,     karyotypes = c("1:0","1:1","2:0","2:1","2:2")     ) #>  #> ── INCOMMON inference of copy number and mutation multiplicity for sample P-0002 #>  #> ℹ Performing classification #> → No LUAD-specific prior probability specified for KRAS #> → Using a pan-cancer prior #> ✔ Loading CNAqc, 'Copy Number Alteration quality check'. text: x object class 'INCOMMON' generated function init. priors dplyr::tibble data frame columns gene, tumor_type, label p indicating tumor-specific pan-cancer (PANCA) prior probabilities. entropy_cutoff Entropy cut-Tier-1 vs Tier-2 assignment. rho -dispersion parameter. karyotypes Karyotypes included among possible classes.

title: Example INCOMMON dataset. — example_data
text: named list following components: mutations data frame containing mutations sample P-0002081-T01-IM3 MSK-MET cohort columns chr, , , ref, alt, gene, NV, DP VAF. sample name sample. tumor_type tumor type sample. purity purity tumor sample (fraction).

title: Example INCOMMON dataset. — example_data
text: MSK-MET cBioPortal https://www.cbioportal.org/study/summary?id=msk_met_2021

title: Example INCOMMON dataset. — example_data
text: columns data frame (mutations) : chr Chromosome harbouring mutation. Genomic start position mutation. Genomic end position mutation. ref Reference allele. alt Alternative allele. gene Gene harbouring mutation. NV Number reads variant DP Total number reads (sequencing depth) VAF Variant allele frequency mutation.

title: Example INCOMMON dataset. — example_data
code: data(example_data) example_data #> $data #> # A tibble: 4 × 9 #>   chr       from       to ref   alt   gene       NV    DP   VAF #>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <int> <int> <dbl> #> 1 chr12 25398285 25398285 C     A     KRAS      378   743 0.509 #> 2 chr17  7577139  7577139 G     A     TP53      116   246 0.472 #> 3 chr19  1221293  1221293 C     A     STK11     122   260 0.469 #> 4 chr19 11141472 11141473 -     C     SMARCA4   133   271 0.491 #>  #> $sample #> [1] "P-0002081-T01-IM3" #>  #> $tumor_type #> [1] "LUAD" #>  #> $purity #> [1] 0.6 #>  if (FALSE) { # Create an example data example <- list( mutations <- data.frame(  chr = c("chr1", "chr14", "chr17"),  # Chromosome column  from = c(16265908, 105246551, 7578503),  # Start position column  to = c(16265908, 105246551, 7578518),  # End position column  ref = c("A", "C", "CAGGGCAGGTCTTGGC"),  # Reference allele column  alt = c("T", "T", "-"),  # Alternate allele column  gene = c("SPEN", "AKT1", "TP53")  # Gene column ),   sample = "P-0000004-T01-IM3",   purity = 0.5 ) }

title: Prepare input for analyses with 'INCOMMON'. — init
text: mutations tibble columns mutant chromosome chr, mutation start position , mutation end position , reference allel ref, alternative allele alt, integer sequencing depth DP, integer number reads variant NV, variant allelic frequency VAF gene name gene Hugo Symbol. sample Sample name ID. tumor_type Tumor type sample. purity Purity sample. gene_roles tibble reporting list gene names associated gene_role among "oncogene", "TSG" "fusion". default taken COSMIC Cancer Gene Census.
